title: Establishes the NYS Triangle Shirtwaist Fire 100th anniversary commemoration commission
summary: Establishes the NYS Triangle Shirtwaist fire 100th anniversary commemoration commission to focus attention upon the 100th anniversary of the Triangle Shirtwaist Fire on March 25, 2011.

       AN  ACT  in  relation to creating the New York state Triangle Shirtwaist
         Fire 100th anniversary commemoration commission; and providing for the
         repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Legislative findings. 1. The legislature hereby finds and
    2  declares there is a need to create a New York state Triangle  Shirtwaist
    3  Fire  100th anniversary commemoration commission to focus attention upon
    4  the 100th anniversary of the March 25, 1911  Triangle  Shirtwaist  Fire,
    5  during a commemoration period taking place March 25, 2011, through Octo-
    6  ber  14,  2011, the anniversary of the date that the American Society of
    7  Safety Engineers was founded as a result of the fire.
    8    2. The primary focus of the New York state  Triangle  Shirtwaist  Fire
    9  100th  anniversary  commemoration commission will be to plan and execute
   10  an organized series of Triangle Shirtwaist Fire educational and  tourism
   11  events.  The  tourism events will highlight the following key sites: the
   12  site of the Triangle Shirtwaist Factory,  Mount  Richmond  Cemetery  and
   13  Cemetery of the Evergreens.
   14    3.  The legislature finds that the creation of a New York state Trian-
   15  gle Shirtwaist Fire 100th anniversary commemoration commission is neces-
   16  sary to bring together persons qualified  by  experience  or  by  powers
   17  vested  in  them  by  their  offices to coordinate and facilitate such a
   18  historically important event.
   19    S 2. New York state Triangle Shirtwaist Fire 100th anniversary commem-
   20  oration commission created. 1. There is hereby created a temporary state

    1  commission to be known as the "New York state Triangle  Shirtwaist  Fire
    2  100th anniversary commemoration commission".
    3    2.  Definitions.  As  used in this act: (a) "Commission" means the New
    4  York state Triangle  Shirtwaist  Fire  100th  anniversary  commemoration
    5  commission created by this section.
    6    (b) "Historical interpreter" means a person who is a recognized member
    7  of  a  duly  constituted  organization approved by the host site and who
    8  participates in the main Triangle Shirtwaist Fire educational and  tour-
    9  ism event for the year.
   10    3.  (a)  The commission shall consist of 13 members to be appointed as
   11  follows: the commissioner of parks, recreation and historic preservation
   12  or his or her duly designated representative, the commissioner of educa-
   13  tion or his or her duly designated representative, the  commissioner  of
   14  economic  development  or his or her duly designated representative, the
   15  commissioner of labor or his  or  her  duly  designated  representative,
   16  representatives  from  the  International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union
   17  (ILGWU), New York University, the National Women's Hall  of  Fame,  Fire
   18  Department  of  New  York, and the Fashion Institute of Technology, four
   19  members of the Triangle Shirtwaist fire reenactment  community  of  whom
   20  one  shall  be  appointed  by the temporary president of the senate, one
   21  shall be appointed  by  the  speaker  of  the  assembly,  one  shall  be
   22  appointed  by  the  minority  leader  of  the  senate  and  one shall be
   23  appointed by the minority leader of the assembly.  The  commissioner  of
   24  parks,  recreation  and  historic preservation or his or her duly desig-
   25  nated representative shall serve as chairperson of the  commission.  The
   26  13 appointed members shall serve at the pleasure of the appointing offi-
   27  cial. Appointments shall be made within 60 days of the effective date of
   28  this  act.  If  a  member misses three meetings his or her seat shall be
   29  considered vacant. Vacancies shall be filled in the manner provided  for
   30  in the original appointments.
   31    (b)  The  members  of the commission shall receive no compensation for
   32  their services but shall be reimbursed for their  actual  and  necessary
   33  expenses incurred by them in the performance of their duties.
   34    (c) Notwithstanding any inconsistent provision of any general, special
   35  or  local  law,  ordinance, resolution or charter, no officer, member or
   36  employee of the state or of any public corporation shall forfeit his  or
   37  her  office or employment by reason of his or her acceptance of appoint-
   38  ment as a member of the commission, nor shall service as such commission
   39  member be deemed incompatible or in conflict with such office or employ-
   40  ment.
   41    (d) The commission shall appoint such staff as  may  be  necessary  to
   42  carry out its duties.
   43    S  3.  Powers  and duties of the commission. The commission shall have
   44  the following powers and duties:
   45    1. To coordinate the commemoration of the  100th  anniversary  of  the
   46  Triangle Shirtwaist Fire.
   47    2.  To plan and execute an organized series of educational and tourism
   48  events focusing on the Triangle Shirtwaist Fire, the founding of  Ameri-
   49  can  Society  of Safety Engineers and the reinvigoration of the Interna-
   50  tional Ladies' Garment Workers' Union.
   51    3. To promote Triangle Shirtwaist Fire educational studies  in  grades
   52  kindergarten through 12 in New York state schools.
   53    S 4. Employment. The commission may employ and at pleasure remove such
   54  personnel as it may deem necessary for the performance of its functions.
   55  The  commission may meet and hold public and private hearings within the

    1  state, and shall have all the powers of a legislative committee pursuant
    2  to the legislative law.
    3    S 5. Assistance and data. The commission may request and shall receive
    4  from  any subdivision, department, board, commission, office, agency, or
    5  other instrumentality of the state or any political subdivision  thereof
    6  such  facilities, assistance and data as it deems necessary or desirable
    7  for the proper execution of its powers and duties and to effectuate  the
    8  purposes set forth in this act.
    9    S  6. Agreements. The commission is hereby authorized and empowered to
   10  enter into any agreements and to do and perform any  acts  that  may  be
   11  necessary,  desirable or proper to carry out the purposes and objectives
   12  of this act.
   13    S 7. This act shall take effect immediately and shall  expire  and  be
   14  deemed repealed October 14, 2011.
